title: Kandarian 2012 Croft Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: Kandorian makes a stainless-steel version of Sauvignon Blanc, and also this heavily-oaked style, which is about as far in the other direction as possible. It's deep gold, scented with strong whiskey-barrel aromas, and tasting of nut oil and superripe apples, plus plenty of oak.

title: Kettmeir 2014 Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Delicate aromas of orchard fruit and white spring flower mingle together while the reserved but refined palate offers green apple and mineral. Crisp acidity and a hint of mineral give it a clean finish.

title: J. Portugal Ramos 2014 Smart Dog Red (Alentejano)
description: A blend of Touriga Nacional and Trincadeira named after Pingo, the winemaker's dog. It's fruity, juicy and fresh with fine acidity and the right balance of spicy tannins. It is ready to drink now.

title: Fantinel 2014 Tenuta Sant'Elena Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Delicate but enticing aromas of white peach and wisteria float from the glass. The lively, linear palate shows Granny Smith apple, Kaiser pear, citrus zest and a ginger note alongside crisp—almost crackling—acidity.

title: Foley 2013 Bar Lazy S Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Browned butter, roasted almonds and walnuts, kumquat cream and iodine show on the nose of this oxidative style from Bill Foley's large portfolio. The palate is rich with toasty brioche and peanut-butter notes.

title: Foris 2014 Chardonnay (Southern Oregon)
description: Soft and smooth, this barrel-fermented wine remains fruit-driven. The barrel time seems to have rounded it off, rather than adding any noticeable toast. Pleasant flavors of apple sauce carry a hint of spice.

title: Griffin Creek 2012 Grenache (Rogue Valley)
description: This Grenache was made in a firm, tannic and quite oaky style. Dark flavors mix black cherry, black licorice and road tar, with some alcoholic burn running along the finish.

title: Griffin Creek 2012 Griffin Red (Rogue Valley)
description: Alone among a lineup of pure single-varietal reds, this reserve-level Meritage blend shows ample fruit, with juicy citrus and sour-cherry flavors. The blend is 75% Cabernet Sauvignon, filled out with Cab Franc, Merlot and Malbec. Chalky acids dominate a short finish.

title: Piccolo 2012 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Two fistfuls of Petite Sirah are added to the mix here, the wine a mix of black cherry and berry around soft, sinewy layers of black pepper and firm tannins. Never overbearing, this wine will do well at the table around plenty of meats.

title: Plaisance Ranch 2014 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Applegate Valley)
description: Barrel-fermented in neutral wood, this gives a quick whiff of buttered croissant, then dives into a moderately ripe palate with lime, pineapple and lemon rind. It's an all-purpose and appealing wine that is drinking nicely right now.

title: Poggiobello 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: This opens with aromas of hay, pressed yellow flower and orchard fruit. The direct palate offers yellow apple skin, toasted nut and a mineral note alongside invigorating acidity.

title: Previous 2013 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Closed and youthful, this wine is medium in build and subtle in oak. It conveys a briny streak throughout the palate, and a distinct taste of candied lemon.

title: Primosic 2014 Santa Lucia Pinot Grigio (Collio)
description: Gold with copper hues, this opens with aromas of wildflower, tangerine zest and a whiff of crushed stone. The vibrant palate offers rennet apple, lime, ginger drop and a hint of mineral alongside mouthwatering acidity.

title: François Lurton 2013 Santa Celina Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendoza)
description: Dry, spicy plum and berry aromas are common and familiar. This feels drawing and fairly full bodied, while herbal, saucy berry flavors show a minor note of green. Like the lead flavors, this finishes a bit green and spicy.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2014 Schiefer Off Dry Riesling (Mosel)
description: There's a fresh, herbaceous feel to this off-dry Riesling, revealing itself in layers of blossomy green florals, lime zest and leaves from nose to finish. This is a sprightly, citrusy wine to be enjoyed young.

title: Gigante 2014 Pinot Grigio (Friuli Colli Orientali)
description: Scents of white spring flower, pear and a hint of nut come together on this lively wine. The racy palate shows pear, apple and white almond alongside firm acidity that leaves a tangy finish.

title: Lawer 2014 Cannon Block Estate Grown Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: Fleshy and full-figured, this wine is made in a big, expansive style. It's rounded in vanillin oak and a bite of honeycomb, with lighter accompaniments of mango and pear.

title: Quinta da Romeira 2014 Prova Régia Arinto (Lisboa)
description: Arinto is the real local grape of the small city of Bucelas where this quinta is located. This fresh wine shows its light mineral and citrus character very well. It also brings out riper fruit flavors that fill it out and give it a rich character. The wine is ready to drink now.

title: Peter Zemmer 2014 Pinot Grigio (Alto Adige)
description: Aromas of wisteria and green apple lead the way on this straightforward white. The tangy palate tastes of juicy pear, citrus and a hint of white almond while zesty acidity and a mineral note give the finish a slight lift.

title: Roche 2013 Barrel Select American Oak Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Thick, rich and ripe in vanilla, the American oak in this wine is pronounced and intense, wrapping itself around notes of candied apple and toffee-caramel.

title: Ronco dei Tassi 2014 Sauvignon (Collio)
description: Grapefruit, mineral and freshly cut grass aromas lead the way. On the palate, brisk acidity supports pink grapefruit, tangerine and a mineral note.

title: St. Pauls 2014 Plotzner Pinot Bianco (Alto Adige)
description: Pear, white flower and crushed rock open on the nose. On the vibrant palate, a mineral note wraps around a core of crisp apple while bracing acidity provides the backbone.

title: Verterra 2012 Vintners Select Reserve Red (Leelanau Peninsula)
description: A blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Cabernet Sauvignon, this brings notes of spiced cherries—including the stems—to the nose and palate. Round and juicy in feel, with soft tannins, a line of racy red currant and graphite keeps the tension.

title: Vincent Price 2012 Prospero Noir Sonoma Stage Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Crispy red fruit, herb, black tea and soft, silky tannins reveal a picture of cool-climate compatibility, the wine medium in build and approachability. Mushroomy earth underlies the fruit and oak, which is most pronounced on the finish.

title: Vinos de Arganza 2013 Século Mencía (Bierzo)
description: Black plum and earthy, schisty aromas include notes of desiccated berry fruits. This is medium-full in body, with fairly sharp acidity. Plum, berry and licorice flavors end with a reprise of high acidity.

title: Weingut Karp-Schreiber 2014 Brauneberger Juffer Kabinett Riesling (Mosel)
description: Wisps of menthol and green herb on the nose contrast a sunny, easy going palate of fresh apple, pear and lemon flavors. Off dry in style, it's a bright, brisk Riesling finishing with bracing firmness. Drink now.

title: Tabor 2011 Adama Merlot (Galilee)
description: Aromas of black cherry and green frying peppers prepare the palate for flavors of cherry, blackberry, green bell pepper and licorice. Smooth tannins and strong fruit flavors are slightly overcome by green notes, and the cool bell pepper finish yields soft touches of cherry.

title: Sauvion NV Brut Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: It's the delicious, clean, crisp fruit that's so good about this wine. It is bright with acidity and crisp apple flavors along with a lemon tang texture giving a fine bite. Stylish and fresh, it is a fine apéritif wine in style.

title: Ca'Ronesca 2010 Marnà Pinot Bianco (Collio)
description: This offers aromas that recall acacia honey, pressed flower and beeswax. The mature, evolved palate shows candied citrus zest, toasted nut and bread crust while a mineral note closes the finish.

title: Casa da Passarella 2012 Enxertia Jaen (Dão)
description: The Jaen grape, local to the Dão, has produced a perfumed juicy wine that is ripe and intensely full of acidity at the same time. It has only light tannins and red berry flavors that are right up front. The wine is ready to drink.
